posts.author: grom56
posts.content:
So here's a silly question:  How do I find all the fancy builds you all keep talking about?   I tried to look up Cleric/Wizard using the "search" option and got a slew of very funky replies in code that I couldn't really read, and the small bits I could read were mostly having to do with wizard/blackguards.  Not really what I was looking for.

So clue me in guys!   How do I find the good stuff?   What am I missing here??

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: If you go to the Rules and Tools sub-forum there are a couple of threads from Hip that should do the trick - these being: "ECB Guild Filter" and "How and Where to Access Legacy ECB Archives". Both involve downloads, but it's all dead easy, even a Luddite like me managed it first time!

posts.author: grom56
posts.content: Downloads huh?   Ah well, thanks for the reply Stag....

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I know, I know, but you don't need to stick them anywhere in particular (oo-er) and you don't need microsoft malarkey like Excel. I work on Open Office and that works just fine.

The Guild Filter is a spreadsheet with basic stats for every completed build from this site on it and a url to connect you to each one. So you can search by class, race, alignment, number of levels, builder, pretty much anything. Iirc, there are about 300 builds there.

The Legacy Archives lets you search all the thousands of builds from the old ECB, which was before my time, but has still led me to unearthing some hidden gems from days of yore (Grizzled Dwarflord's Hearth Guard is a particular favourite of mine).

Go on, you know you want to...

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Stag's advice is as usual a sound one, you need to DL the Legacy Archives at some point which has the traditional filter for builds with all the builds of the old ECB.

That being said, the search here is also good. What you need to do is put the keyword normally in the white box and then select the option "search topic titles only" from down below. Doing that for example with the keyword "Cleric/Wizard" will now find you only three answers. It will still show the html code below but just above it will be the Topic's Title, just click on it and you go to the thread.

"Speedy Sniper" by Max, was one of the answers for that particular search.
=> viewtopic.php?f=8&t=2335699&p=478&hilit ... izard#p478

posts.author: grom56
posts.content: Ok, you two talked me into doing the downloads.  Grabbed all three files and put them in my "C" drive.  Then I started reading Hips info on how to use, and my head started to hurt....  I'm going to go grab a handful of beers and then see if it all then makes sense.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Good choice! (I like them dark-coloured myself).

Now that's out of the way, here is how i use them.


Step A. Open up your Epic Character Builders folder and inside it you will find three seperate folders named "Builds", "Builds Search" and "Images".
Step B. Open up your "Builds Search" folder and inside it you find some stuff. Ignore them all apart from the "ECB_search.html". Click on that and it opens a seperate page in your browser with the old search engine.
Step C. Enjoy!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Valerfor's bang on with the Legacy Archive stuff (of course).

As for the Guild Filter (and don't tell Hip I said this, because his guide is very well put together and comprehensive - he did a marvellous job with the whole thing), the easiest way to use it is just open up the bag of tricks file (iirc it's about 330 megabytes, in case you're not sure which one it is), look at it, and play with it - it's one of those things that's much easier to use than it is to describe how to use. And this from someone who has only just learned how to spell teknolojie, so it must be alright.

That said, beers will help. But then, when don't they?

Cheers

posts.author: grom56
posts.content: Here's where I get lost:  I'm in windows explorer and I find the files.  Now you all say that by running the search file I will get a new page on my browser?   I'm not on the internet.  Does this file open IE automatically?   As you can see, I'm not even a tiny bit techish....   Is it ok to wash the aspirin down with many beers???

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Excellent, Grom - you lost me, too!

All I can say (about the Guild Filter, anyway) is how I go about things. So...

I go to wherever I've parked the download - in my case, the F drive, then I click on the ECB builds xls file. It opens (you don't have to be on the internet to do this). I then see a spreadsheet of some 280 listed builds. I look for the sort of attributes I want to look for, then, when I've narrowed it down I go to each build's URL (listed and clickable) and click on one. That opens that particular build on this forum like magic. I look at it. If it's not quite right for me, I close it and that takes me back to the spreadsheet, etc, etc.

Not very helpful perhaps, but the best I can do, as one of similar tech-aversion.

And yes, of course washing down aspirin down with beers is ok...is there another way of taking them?

posts.author: gkorjax
posts.content:
One can still use the whole NWN Character Build Search engine as it was intended to be used, i.e. by filling in the drop down boxes with what class(es) you are interested in builds for, input the levels of each class, etc, by race, etc.  It opens up your browser, even if you are not connected to the internet, and loads up the page(s) locally.

Simply go to the folder where you've extracted all the files, navigate to the folder buildsearch
Inside this folder find the file ECB_search.html
Right click on this file, and choose open with
(choose internet explorer, or firefox. I can not get it to work with chrome.)

To choose the right file it helps to make sure you are able to view file extensions. If you can't see file extensions, google how to do that. By the way, ECB_search.html is the eigth file down in the buildsearch folder for me, in case you can't see file extensions.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Alright, i think i know what happened with Grom's search...
All the previous info still applies but in search options you must select "Show as Topics".

That's it, no more html code shown or anything else.
Myself, i always use this option so it was hard for me to imagine what happened, but with some reverse engineering it was obvious after a while...

posts.content: Did it work, mate?
